column4: Issue Details

column3: Make better use of AssertJ's string matchers
column4: Where we are using `String#format(...)` to deal with platform-specific line endings, we can instead use `isEqualToNormalizingNewlines`.  We can also replace some calls to `String#format(String...)` with AssertJ's built-in support for format strings.

column3: Cannot inject a custom principal into unauthenticated request
column4: When a method in a Jersey resource has a parameter (for instance of some type `User`) annotated with `@Auth` and authentication fails, the following exception is thrown:  ``` ERROR [2022-05-02 08:34:03,534] io.dropwizard.jersey.errors.IllegalStateExceptionMapper: Error handling a request: 1fa109dc501e3397 ! java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot inject a custom principal into unauthenticated request ! at io.dropwizard.auth.PrincipalContainerRequestValueFactory.provide(PrincipalContainerRequestValueFactory.java:25) ! at io.dropwizard.auth.AuthValueFactoryProvider.lambda$createValueProvider$1(AuthValueFactoryProvider.java:51) ! at org.glassfish.jersey.server.spi.internal.ParamValueFactoryWithSource.apply(ParamValueFactoryWithSource.java:50) ```  While I can clearly see where this is coming from, I am not sure that it is always practical. It seems that Dropwizard requires authentication prior to injecting a principal, which is somewhat reasonable for many scenarios. For a particular application, I need a resource that also accepts anonymous (e.g. `null`) users to serve public content (whereas authenticated and authorized users see the public content plus X with X being the protected content).  As a workaround, I could append an AnonymousAuthenticator at the end of an Auth Chain and let this one create the `User` object. If Chained authentication is not necessary, a separate code path in a dedicated authenticator might also do the job (but is a dead end as soon as the application requires an additional authentication mechanism.)  So in general I can mitigate my particular problem in some ways but none of them feels 100% right. Is there a good reason why Dropwizard does not simply inject a NULL Principal if authentication cannot be performed?

column3: Upgrade dropwizard-jdbi3 dependency to use latest jdbi3-core dependency
column4: We use dropwizard-jdbi3 dependency of version 2.0.29 for database operations and internally it uses jdbi3-core dependency of version 3.28.0. We were facing some issue so we filed a ticket to jdbi community for fixing the issue. After investigation they found out a bug and fixed the issue in the jdbi3-core library and merged their changes to master branch. So we would like to uptake the latest changes they made in the jdbi3-core library. could you please upgrade dropwizard-jdbi3 dependency so that it uses the latest jdbi3-core (3.32.0) ? jdbi bug link : https://github.com/jdbi/jdbi/issues/2065

column3: Can't configure the variable maxIdle of DataSourceFactory
column4: We have encountred a problem related to the number of inactif connections that still opened and to resolve this problem we have to set the maxIdle variable in DataSourceFactory(now it is setted with the maxSize variable).

column3: Replace dropwizard-util collection wrappers with JCL
column4: We can use the JCL collections helpers to replace these utility classes.  Remove:  - io.dropwizard.util.Lists - io.dropwizard.util.Maps - io.dropwizard.util.Sets  This also allows us to remove dropwizard-util as a dependency of  - dropwizard-auth - dropwizard-configuration - dropwizard-json-logging - dropwizard-migrations - dropwizard-views  Remove it from dropwizard-request-logging too, as it wasn't used there.
We can use `Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)` instead of explicitly checking for `Optional#isPresent()` here.

column3: Make better use of AssertJ in `GzipDefaultVaryBehaviourTest`
column4: We can use `containsEntry` here and chain the assertions.
We can construct a `ThreadFactory` without Guava's help.  This also fixes a potential format string injection in the healthcheck thread name.

version:dropwizard-db-0.8.5  jdbcurl added autoReconnect=true  ``` com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.CommunicationsException: The last packet successfully received from the server was 46,229,971 milliseconds ago.  The last packet sent successfully to the server was 46,229,971 milliseconds ago. is longer than the server configured value of 'wait_timeout'. You should consider either expiring and/or testing connection validity before use in your application, increasing the server configured values for client timeouts, or using the Connector/J connection property 'autoReconnect=true' to avoid this problem. ```

Validate the behaviour of `SslReloadTask`, i.e. that it performs a dry-run of all `SslReload`ers and only performs the reload if they all succeed their dry run.  Move the dry run logic into `SslReload` in order to simplify testing.  Deprecate `SslReload#reload(SslContextFactory)` as it is no longer required
Use https://github.com/ScaCap/action-surefire-report for collecting and publishing Surefire test reports.
Use https://github.com/ScaCap/action-surefire-report for collecting and publishing Surefire test reports.

Upon upgrading to Dropwizard 2.1.0, we encountered a LinkageError from Jackson Blackbird as described in this [issue](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-modules-base/issues/169).  `java.lang.LinkageError: loader 'app' attempted duplicate class definition for com.xxxx.$$JacksonBlackbirdAccess. (com.xxxx.$$JacksonBlackbirdAccess is in unnamed module of loader 'app')`  This causes httpclient to react and shutdown ([as described here](https://blog.adebski.com/posts/apache-http-client-shutting-down/)): `java.lang.IllegalStateException: Connection pool shut down`.  The issue is addressed in 2.13.3, can we expect an upgrade to this version in following dot releases of 2.1.x?

column3: Dropwizard upgraded to 2.1.0 - Getting BlackBird warning
column4: Upon upgrading from dropwizard `2.0.25` to `2.1.0`, This warning is emitted whenever the application boots:  ``` WARN  [2022-05-26 10:38:18,889] com.fasterxml.jackson.module.blackbird.BlackbirdModule: Unable to find Java 9+ MethodHandles.privateLookupIn.  Blackbird is not performing optimally! ! java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.privateLookupIn(Ljava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandles$Lookup;)Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandles$Lookup; ```  What does this error mean? is it looking for Java 9+ functionality that is not available in my Java 8 environment?  Also:  > Blackbird is not performing optimally!  Am I incurring a performance cost here vis-a-vis dropwizard `2.0.25`?

Move assertion logic to the base class, with subclasses simply supplying the string to check for.  This should remove 1 of the 6 'Blocker' issues in Sonar.  Not sure I'm completely satisfied with the result, but see what you think....

column3: Remove duplicate logfile from dropwizard-logging tests (#4568)
column4: This was added in cc53136ae8754c20df268b6ea1a0cf3528618450 but isn't used by the tests.  It causes errors to be logged during tests as the `currentLogFilename` is identical to another log configuration in the same file.  `FileAppenderFactoryTest` tests the behaviour of `FileAppenderFactory` directly without roundtripping through the YAML configuration parser.  Remove the duplicate log file definition.

This should've been part of 2df06548a8821c92446c1b8e4055bdd81afbe79b but it got missed.  Also that commit got the path to `person.json` incorrect. The earlier parts of the docs say to put it in `src/test/resources/fixtures` so make the code consistent with that.  Refs https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4890
This PR re-enables the Windows runners.  Closes #3415 Closes #4330

This PR provides fixes for failing tests:  - Liquibase 4.14.0 introduced a wording change from "change set" to "changeset", which breaks a test in the `dropwizard-migrations` module  - the introduction of the Grizzly connector in Dropwizard 2.1.1 broke some tests on Windows with the message "Remotely closed". This seems to be related to the `ClientProperties.REQUEST_ENTITY_PROCESSING` property, which was set to `RequestEntityProcessing.BUFFERED` while using the `HttpUrlConnectorProvider` and is now set to `RequestEntityProcessing.CHUNKED` in the `GrizzlyConnectorProvider`.

This PR provides dependency updates to do the 'big-bang-change' from the `javax` to the `jakarta` namespace.  This PR just updates the dependencies, it doesn't target any deprecations or other changes.

This PR provides dependency updates for `httpclient` and `httpcore`. Following the migration guide, all classes are reimported and conflicts are resolved.  Support for deprecated fields was dropped, but I've seen that `HttpProcessor` can be re-added with providing `HttpRequestInterceptor` and `HttpResponseInterceptor` objects to the `HttpClientBuilder`. But therefore we have to decide whether to use `add...InterceptorFirst(...)` or `add...InterceptorLast(...)`. Any opinions on that?

This PR provides a dependency update to Jetty major version 10.  As discussed earlier in various issues and discussions, Jetty 10 will break request logging with Logback 1.2.x. After playing around a bit with this branch, I fixed it with overriding the `log` method of the `LogbackAccessRequestLog` class and providing a custom `ServerAdapter` implementation.  This means we would have to adjust those classes ourselves when Logback provides changes, but I think being blocked for our 3.0.x release is worse then doing this. @dropwizard/committers if anyone has an other opinion on this, please feel free to close this PR.

column3: Modification to show issue for target property of logging appender
column4: This PR is to modify this dropwizard-example to expose the issue.  When setting "target: stdout" in the test-example.yml and setting bootstrap.getObjectMapper().enable(DeserializationFeature.READ_UNKNOWN_ENUM_VALUES_USING_DEFAULT_VALUE) it will show that the lowercase setting "stdout" for the target property of Logging appender is not accepted.

column3: Add notes for breaking changes in Jersey and Liquibase
column4: This PR adds some details for the upcoming versioning change and for the breaking changes the upgrades of Liquibase and Jersey introduce for the migration towards Dropwizard 2.1.

column3: Include runnable code snippets into docs
column4: This PR adapts the current changes of `release/3.0.x` to the great work @joschi did in #3327 and integrates `:start-after:` and `:end-before:`.  The naming conventions I used in the comments can definitely be improved, but this is just a test to examine the maintainability of this approach.

column3: Ignore code coverage metrics for dropwizard-benchmarks
column4: This module's code is already test code. Don't report on test coverage for it.  Note: I'm not sure if this is quite the way to do it - the Sonar docs aren't very clear to me.  https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/project-administration/narrowing-the-focus/#header-3

This method is fairly tricky to test, but previously had no coverage. Ideas to make this test better would be appreciated.  Part of a mini-quest to kill that Sonar error about not meeting 80% test coverage on new code.

column3: Make more use of `ResourceConfigurationSourceProvider` in tests
column4: This is neater than using `ResourceHelpers#resourceFilePath(String)`.  Clean up a few linter gripes in the affected tests at the same time.

This is an internal class which should probably be package-private.  Mark it deprecated as a step towards doing that.  (this is as an alternative to just straight up doing that - https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4569)

This is a bit of a noop change - I don't think there were any gaps in the control flow.  Sonar was struggling to work out whether cases could fall-through, but they can't.  Still, moving the `return 0` to the end of each case statement makes it very clear what the behaviour will be.

This is a bit of a grab-bag of random changes, addressing linter concerns from Sonar and IntelliJ. Mostly in tests, but not all.  Remove usage of raw generic types in a few places.  Remove a couple of deprecated usages: - Remove usage of `@OverridesAttribute.List` - Update BadLogApp to avoid overriding deprecated methods  Some random cleanups: - Remove unnecessary cast and unused local variable - Remove unused imports  A few test simplifications: - Tighten assertion in DataSourceFactoryTest - Simplify lambdas in tests - Use try-with-resources in AllowedMethodsFilterTest - Use more specific AssertJ assertions - Simplify InjectValidatorFeatureTest
This Guava helper has been deprecated in 2.x and can be removed for 3.x.
This class is only used by `HttpConnectorFactory` so it can be package-private.  This is technically a breaking change, but maybe an acceptable one?

column3: Remove `public` modifiers from nested test classes and test methods
column4: This change was inspired by Sonar complaining about `public` members in the `DropwizardExtensionsSupportTest`.

column3: rework auth filter injection behavior to only setup injection once at startup
column4: This change reworks the DI setup for auth filters to inject only once during setup and not on every request.  When injection is performed, each injectable field is assigned a special proxy class that is automatically updated to the per-request values. The `InjectionManager.inject()` method does not need to be invoked for each request.  The following links provide helpful explanations of the behavior: - https://stackoverflow.com/a/35953104/901236 - https://psamsotha.github.io/jersey/2015/12/16/request-scope-into-singleton-scope.html  Resolves: #5191 Closes: #5196
This allows us to drop a dependency on jcip-annnotations
These were unintentionally public in previous versions and had a deprecation warning saying they would be made package-private.  Make them package-private.
These have been superseded by `DataSize` and `DataSizeUnit`.  Refs https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/2686

These dependency vulnerabilities exist in 2.1.1 and older.  ``` 11:26:38.170 [ERROR] One or more dependencies were identified with vulnerabilities that have a CVSS score greater than or equal to '0.0': 11:26:38.171 [ERROR] 11:26:38.171 [ERROR] jetty-http-9.4.44.v20210927.jar: CVE-2022-2047 11:26:38.171 [ERROR] jetty-io-9.4.44.v20210927.jar: CVE-2022-2191 ```  Relevant packages are `dropwizard-jersey` and `dropwizard-jetty`, respectively.

These are all deprecated in 2.1.x and unused by Dropwizard itself.  Replace `ByteStream#toByteArray()` with `InputStream#readAllBytes()`  I've left `Size` and `SizeUnit` because removing those is a bit less trivial and worth doing separately.
The merge of 2.1.x contains imports to classes, for which the namespace was changed.

column4: The automatic module name causes issues when generating Javadoc during the release process.  Let's revert that particular change so we can get the first beta builds out of the door and take care of it when we have more time to take care of the issues.  `release/3.0.x`: https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/runs/5875633807?check_suite_focus=true#step:4:3444 ```text Error:  Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-javadoc-plugin:3.3.2:jar (attach-javadocs) on project dropwizard-jersey: MavenReportException: Error while generating Javadoc:  Error:  Exit code: 1 - /home/runner/work/dropwizard/dropwizard/dropwizard-jersey/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/jersey/DropwizardResourceConfig.java:29: error: cannot find symbol Error:  import javax.annotation.Nullable; Error:                         ^ Error:    symbol:   class Nullable Error:    location: package javax.annotation [...] Error:  Command line was: /usr/lib/jvm/temurin-11-jdk-amd64/bin/javadoc @options @packages Error:   Error:  Refer to the generated Javadoc files in '/home/runner/work/dropwizard/dropwizard/dropwizard-jersey/target/apidocs' dir. ```   `release/4.0.x`: https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/runs/5875544966?check_suite_focus=true#step:4:10598 ```text Error:  Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-javadoc-plugin:3.3.2:jar (attach-javadocs) on project dropwizard-testing: MavenReportException: Error while generating Javadoc:  Error:  Exit code: 1 - /home/runner/work/dropwizard/dropwizard/dropwizard-testing/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/testing/common/DropwizardTestResourceConfig.java:22: error: cannot access ResourceConfig Error:  class DropwizardTestResourceConfig extends DropwizardResourceConfig { Error:  ^ Error:    class file for org.glassfish.jersey.server.ResourceConfig not found Error:  /home/runner/work/dropwizard/dropwizard/dropwizard-testing/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/testing/junit5/DropwizardExtensionsSupport.java:8: error: package org.junit.platform.commons.util is not visible Error:  import org.junit.platform.commons.util.ReflectionUtils; Error:                                   ^ Error:    (package org.junit.platform.commons.util is declared in module org.junit.platform.commons, which does not export it to module io.dropwizard.testing) Error:   Error:  Command line was: /usr/lib/jvm/temurin-11-jdk-amd64/bin/javadoc @options @packages ```  This reverts commit da2b0540d58b5e8057d77c4b2cda5a19a241a92d. Refs #2926 Refs #5136

The `HealthCheckManagerTest` in the `dropwizard-health` package seems to be unstable on Appveyor. The recent Appveyor builds seemed all to run rather slow, but the slow runs may block tests long enough, such that tests could eventually fail.  Here are some log excerpts from Appveyor logs from recent pull requests: ``` 13:21:46.285 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=1 13:21:46.297 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=2 13:21:46.338 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=3 13:21:46.369 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=4 13:21:46.374 [Thread-4] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManager - delayed shutdown: started (waiting 50 milliseconds) 13:21:46.380 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=5 13:21:46.400 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=6 13:21:46.416 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=7 13:21:46.431 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=8 13:21:46.431 [Thread-4] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManager - delayed shutdown: finished 13:21:46.447 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=9 13:21:46.463 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=10 ```  ``` 13:42:17.503 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=1 13:42:17.505 [Thread-4] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManager - delayed shutdown: started (waiting 50 milliseconds) 13:42:17.571 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=2 13:42:17.571 [Thread-4] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManager - delayed shutdown: finished 13:42:17.587 [pool-3-thread-1] INFO io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManagerTest$CountingHealthCheck - count=3 ```  As the first excerpt shows, the build can succeed and the count values from 5 to 8 are logged within the 50 milliseconds shutdown wait period. In the latter excerpt however, the `pool-3-thread-1` seems to be slow or even blocked and no log entry is written, until the shutdown wait period is over.  I'm just wondering, what to do about this. Since I've never seen CircleCI or GitHub Actions builds failing, I see no issue with the test here. And as the builds only fail sometimes on Appveyor, I also wouldn't assume a Windows issue. The only option I currently see, is to disable the Appveyor run (with disabling the test on Windows). Are there any other opinions I'm missing?

Test the behaviour of `HealthCheckManager#healthStateView()` and `HealthCheckManager#healthStateViews()`  Question: Is it correct that when a healthcheck is removed via `HealthCheckManager#onHealthCheckRemoved()`, `HealthCheckManager#healthStateViews()` returns a collection containing `null`? Should `onHealthCheckRemoved()` remove it from the `checks` collection?  `onHealthCheckRemoved()` is never called by Dropwizard.

column3: v2.1.0-beta.8 broke use of AuthDynamicFeature with non-AuthFilter authentication filter
column4: Starting with v2.1.0-beta.8, our use of `dropwizard-auth`'s `AuthDynamicFeature` to handle registering our custom authentication filter (read: not based on `io.dropwizard.auth.AuthFilter`) for annotated resource methods, broke.  ``` ERROR [2022-04-18 18:49:12,871] org.glassfish.grizzly.servlet.ServletHandler: service exception: ! java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The filter must be an instance of AuthFilter ! at io.dropwizard.auth.InjectingFilter.(InjectingFilter.java:34) ! at io.dropwizard.auth.AuthDynamicFeature.registerAuthFilter(AuthDynamicFeature.java:102) ! at io.dropwizard.auth.AuthDynamicFeature.registerAuthFilter(AuthDynamicFeature.java:95) ! at io.dropwizard.auth.AuthDynamicFeature.configure(AuthDynamicFeature.java:67) ```  Because we need additional behavior beyond what the `AuthFilter` provides, we create our own `ContainerRequestFilter` and register that using `io.dropwizard.auth.AuthDynamicFeature` from the dropwizard-auth module so that we can use the various JAX-RS authz annotations (e.g. `RolesAllowed`, `PermitAll`) as well as the `@Auth` annotation from Dropwizard in order to control which resource methods the authentication filter is applied to.   This has worked fine with previous versions of Dropwizard and has been working fine even with v2.1.0-beta.7.   It looks like the change in behavior was introduced as part of this PR: https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4563 The change looks like it is now wrapping the user's provided ContainerRequestFilter instance inside another ContainerRequestFilter named `InjectingFilter`. The `InjectingFilter` is throwing the error because my ContainerRequestFilter is not an instanceof `AuthFilter` (line 34).   CC: @zUniQueX

column3: Avoid shadowing class fields with local variables
column4: Sonar isn't a fan of this. Coming up with pleasing alternate names for these variables isn't easy, however.

Sonar gets upset when a method does nothing without explaining why.  In some cases, the empty methods can just fall back to a default no-op implementation in the corresponding `interface` - remove such methods.  For the rest, add a comment explaining why the method is empty, or at least acknowledging that it does nothing intentionally.

column3: Support for customizing the application's ObjectMapper
column4: Some users of Dropwizard 2.x and Java 8 want to be able to customize the application's `ObjectMapper` instance in a more granular way than it was possible before.  This change set adds the `ObjectMapperFactory` interface and a default implementation which replaces the existing `Jackson` class which offered only static methods to construct a preconfigured `ObjectMapper` instance.  Refs https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/discussions/5319

Since `Size` is deprecated, it makes sense for these conversion methods to also be deprecated.  Annotate the corresponding tests as `@Deprecated` as an alternative to `@SuppressWarnings`.  Also deprecate `SizeBenchmark` for the same reason.

Restrict the GitHub token permissions only to the required ones; this way, even if the attackers will succeed in compromising your workflow, they won’t be able to do much.  - Included permissions for the action. https://github.com/ossf/scorecard/blob/main/docs/checks.md#token-permissions  https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#permissions  https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-jobs/assigning-permissions-to-jobs  [Keeping your GitHub Actions and workflows secure Part 1: Preventing pwn requests](https://securitylab.github.com/research/github-actions-preventing-pwn-requests/)  Signed-off-by: naveensrinivasan <172697+naveensrinivasan@users.noreply.github.com>

Remove the following deprecated methods:  - `Authorizer#authorize(P, String)` - `HttpsConnectorFactory#logSslInfoOnStart(SslContextFactory)` - `DefaultHealthFactory#getHealthChecks()` - `DefaultHealthFactory#setHealthChecks(List)`

Remove the following classes from io.dropwizard.jersey.params:  - DateTimeParam - DurationParam - InstantParam - LocalDateParam  These were deprecated and slated for removal in 3.0.0  Also, remove Joda Time from `dropwizard-jdbi3`, `dropwizard-jersey` and `dropwizard-hibernate`, removing it from Dropwizard altogether in favour of JSR310's `java.time.*` classes.

Remove most of the code which is marked deprecated.  - Remove deprecated `FixtureHelpers` from dropwizard-testing - Remove deprecated methods from `DataSourceFactory` and `PooledDataSourceFactory` - Remove deprecated constructors from `DropwizardAppExtension` - Remove deprecated constructors from `DropwizardTestSupport` - Remove deprecated `ViewMessageBodyWriter#ViewMessageBodyWriter(MetricRegistry)` - Remove deprecated `SslReload#reload(SslContextFactory)` - Remove deprecated `AssertServlet#getResourceUrl(String)` - Remove deprecated `Application#onFatalError()` - Remove deprecated `Bundle` from dropwizard-core - Remove deprecated `Authorizer#authorize(P, String)` - Remove deprecated `HttpsConnectorFactory#logSslInfoOnStart(SslContextFactory)` - Remove deprecated methods from `DefaultHealthFactory` - Remove deprecated no-op inflate stream support from `GzipHandlerFactory`  After this, the remaining deprecated code is:  - junit 4.x support in dropwizard-testing - is the plan to keep this for 3.x? - various `*Param` classes in dropwizard-jersey - being removed in https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4957 - dropwizard-hibernate `AbstractDAO#criteria()` - no need to remove this until it gets removed from hibernate itself - dropwizard-servlets `PostBodyTask#execute(Map>, PrintWriter)` - this is marked deprecated as a way of futzing with the inheritance tree - excluding by user agent in dropwizard-jetty `GzipHandlerFactory` - this will need removing when Jetty is upgraded to 10 - `FreemarkerViewRenderer#FreemarkerViewRenderer()` - removing this caused the Windows build to fail due to a service discovery issue

column3: Support PATCH HTTP method on Java 17
column4: Refs #4404   ###### Problem: The `JerseyClientBuilder` provided in `DropwizardAppExtension` uses the default connector provider, i.e. `HttpUrlConnectorProvider`. As stated in [this comment](https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/jersey/issues/4825#issuecomment-925836004), this connector provider will not support the HTTP PATCH method on Java 16+.  ###### Solution: Use an other connector provider, which natively supports the HTTP PATCH method. This PR uses the `GrizzlyConnectorProvider` because it passes most of our tests.  ###### Breaking change: This PR technically is a breaking change, since the obtained client builder is configured differently. But as the HTTP PATCH method will not work on Java 16+, this is a tradeoff IMO. I think we could introduce this change because a different `JerseyClientBuilder` can be obtained easily and hence we should have a client working on Java 16+ as a default.

column3: Replace JAX-RS ClientBuilder with Jersey's JerseyClientBuilder
column4: Refs #3847   `dropwizard-testing` mostly already uses the `JerseyClientBuilder`, the remaining changes are added for consistency.  `HttpHealthCheck` doesn't expose the `Client`, so the change is unproblematic too.  Only the client used in `dropwizard-client` gets exposed to the user. But as `JerseyIgnoreRequestUserAgentHeaderFilter` relies on a Jersey `ClientRequest` and is registered by default, other implementations would probably fail. So the change to `JerseyClientBuilder` should be reasonable to provide a working instance for every user.

column4: Refs #3685

column3: Provide method to override exception type for auth filters
column4: Raised for consideration regarding the discussion in #4213.
Raised for consideration regarding issue #4613.

column3: Do not throw `IOException`s from servlet methods
column4: Raised for consideration regarding issue #4279.  This PR suppresses `IOException`s from being thrown from servlet methods since Sonar suggests not to throw them because of the possibility of denial of service attacks or information exposure.  Therefore the `IOException` from an error at `getWriter()` is logged and a status code 500 is set. Calls to `sendError(...)` are converted to ```java if (!response.isCommitted()) {     response.reset();     response.setStatus(...); } ``` since this code won't throw an exception. This results in not committing the response in the servlet method and deferring the processing to the underlying servlet container.

column3: ManagedPooledDataSource never added to the lifecycle
column4: ManagedPooledDataSource is not being added to the lifecycle. SessionFactoryManager is being added and it do call start method on the ManagedPooledDataSource instance. But without having access to the ManagedPooledDataSource there is no way to enable credentials rotation by changing user/password. Is there any security reason that ManagedPooledDataSource is not being added to the lifecycle.
jUnit can do the hard work for us here

jUnit 5 introduces `DisabledIf` and `EnabledIf`, allowing tests or entire test classes to be disabled based on arbitrary conditions.  Replace use of `assumeThat` with this newer mechanism.  I'm not completely convinced, personally - it's not as type-safe (although IntelliJ IDEA knows about it).  For the tests where we did `assumeThat` in a `BeforeEach`, this should be more performant I suppose, but the rest are much of a muchness I think.  See what you think...  For `dropwizard-jersey/src/test/java/io/dropwizard/jersey/validation/ConstraintViolationExceptionMapperTest.java` I just removed the `assumeThat` since the test explicitly changes the locale anyway (which is probably bad?!).

column3: overlapping use of jakarta.inject and jakarta.inject-api
column4: jakarta.inject and jakarta.inject-api both include javax.inject classes.   dropwizard-core depends on jersey-bean-validation and jersey-common which both depend on jakarta.inject. core also depends on dropwizard-jersey which depends on jakarta.inject-api.   dropwizard-testing also uses jakarta-inject, while dropwizard-auth uses jakarta.inject-api.  I can use exclusions in my pom file to work around this, but dropwizard should be consistent on which one it uses across projects.

It would be nice if the DropWizard `Duration` class had a different name like `ConfigurationDuration` or `YamlReadableDuration` or something like that. I find that a lot of the APIs I use need a regular `java.time.Duration` and I ended up having to fully qualify one or the other. Most of us only use the DropWizard Duration as a simpler string to write in a config file.   Another solution would be to add a method `toJavaDuration()` so I can just take one of those and turn it into the `java.time.Duration` I need.   Minor for sure, just thought I'd document it while I was running into it.

It turns out that Jackson Blackbird isn't better/faster on Java 11/17/18 right now and Jackson Afterburner still works.  Let's revert the change from Jackson Afterburner to Blackbird in Dropwizard 2.1.x and keep using it in Dropwizard 3.x and later.  This reverts commit c65d010cc05031a6c8efaa380b0d0d123c3234bc. Refs #3803
Is there a way by which we can disable the default jetty timers being pushed to /metrics.  Example: `io.dropwizard.jetty.MutableServletContextHandler.get-requests`

column4: Is "it passes tests" enough validation?  Use `CtClass#toClass(MethodHandles.Lookup)` to register resources. Note that I'm not really familiar with this API - am I doing it right?  The javaassist docs suggest this will work under both Java 8 and 11.  Deprecate `JavaVersion` as it is now unused.
Introduce [Spotless](https://github.com/diffplug/spotless/tree/maven/2.22.5/plugin-maven) for automatic code formatting.

column3: Use Jetty's `Resource` to locate truststore in `Http2TestCommon`
column4: Instead of using our own `ResourceHelpers` class, since `SslContextFactory` is a jetty util class, use the Jetty util class `Resource` to load our test truststore from the classpath.  This reduces our usage of `ResourceHelpers` to be obtaining absolute paths to files in order to supply config overrides or to pass to `Application#run()`

Including Logback's alpha versions, the dependencies could now be updated to the `jakarta` namespace.  Should we - as most other Jakarta EE components - support both the `javax` and the `jakarta` namespace and therefore build Dropwizard 3, or should we postpone the upgrade?

column3: initialOverallState does not transition to true when there are no registered checks
column4: In the new health check functionality introduced in Dropwizard 2.1.0, if you set: ```yaml health:   initialOverallState: false ``` but have no checks registered for a specific type (either `alive` or `health`), then the overall state will never transition to `true`.  This is because the overall app state is calculated by `HealthCheckManager` only when there is a state change from a health check: https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/blob/dd25ab7b61052721af2ebec54a6b8da5ced30edd/dropwizard-health/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/health/HealthCheckManager.java#L161 https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/blob/dd25ab7b61052721af2ebec54a6b8da5ced30edd/dropwizard-health/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/health/HealthCheckManager.java#L197  And if there aren't any checks, then no state change triggers and the state is never recalculated (even though the counter of failed checks is actually zero).  I guess that Dropwizard must do an explicit test and in case there aren't any checks registered, consider that the condition is satisfied (technically it is) and instantly set the respective flag (`isAppAlive` or `isAppHealthy`) to `true`.

column3: FuzzyEnumParamConverter does not allow some error responses to be remapped using exception mappers
column4: If `FuzzyEnumParamConverter` calls the `fromStringMethod` but is unable to convert the string to an enum value, it will throw a `WebApplicationException` constructed using a `Response` parameter instead of constructed using a `String` message. This will cause Jersey to return the `Response` as-is, bypassing any exception mappers that may be set up. This prevents exception mappers from being used to return error messages in a consistent format if an invalid enum value is provided as a path parameter. `FuzzyEnumParamConverter` should construct the `WebApplicationException` using a `String` message parameter instead of a `Response` so that it can be remapped into a response by the exception mappers.  I'm planning on submitting a PR to fix this issue.

I've seen SslReloadBundle, but that seems like it places the burden of noticing that certificates have changed on some external daemon, when it might as well be handled internally.  In my use case, as I suspect many others, certificates are rotated by an external daemon such as cert-manager that simply replaces the certificates when they are about to expire and that daemon doesn't particularly have a need to know about the consumer of the certificate.  The true Kubernetes way to consume certificates would be to use the API server to watch the certificate resource and reload it when it changes, but that comes with a somewhat heavy burden of having to depend on the k8s api, when that might not otherwise be needed.  I think the simplest solution is to simply mount the TLS secret in the filesystem and load the certificates from the file system and then periodically poll the files for changes.  For my own dropwizard-kubernetes-https module I've implemented a very simple automatic ssl reloader that does not need an external daemon to poke the server to reload the certificates and I wonder if something like this is a candidate for core?  https://gitlab.com/dren.dk/dropwizard-kubernetes-https/-/tree/main/src/main/java/dk/dren/dw/k8s/https/reloader

column3: Error about filename collision in dropwizard-logging tests
column4: I was going to raise a PR, but I'm not really sure what the fix should be, so I'm raising an issue instead.  During the dropwizard-logging tests, this error is logged:  ``` 13:19:50,448 |-ERROR in ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender[file-appender] - 'File' option has the same value "./logs/max-file-size-example.log" as that given for appender [file-appender] defined earlier. 13:19:50,448 |-ERROR in ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender[file-appender] - Collisions detected with FileAppender/RollingAppender instances defined earlier. Aborting. 13:19:50,448 |-ERROR in ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender[file-appender] - For more information, please visit http://logback.qos.ch/codes.html#earlier_fa_collision ```  The cause looks to date back all the way to 2015 in commit cc53136ae8754c20df268b6ea1a0cf3528618450 which adds an extra logfile to the test logging config, but with the same name as one which already exists.  What's the right thing to do? Remove one of them or change the names so they don't clash?

column3: Which REST API is being used in Dropwizard 2.0.28, jakarta.ws.rs OR javax.ws.rs OR both?
column4: I see there is a mixed usage of REST API in DW 2.0.28: in most (if not all) such as `dropwizard-auth` and `dropwizard-hibernate`, there are dependencies on `dropwizard-jersey`, which depends on `javax.ws.rs`. For example, the class `io.dropwizard.jersey.params.AbstractParam` has a lot of imports from` javax.ws`. In the meanwhile, DW also depends on` jakarta.ws.rs-api`.   It looks like both `jakarta.ws.rs` and `javax.ws.rs` APIs are used in DW, right? Can I use just one of them? If yes, where/how to specify that?  I ask this question because I encountered a problem in my DW/Jersey based Web Application, which is caused by the mixed-use of the two:  ``` java.lang.VerifyError: Bad type on operand stack Exception Details:   Location:     org/glassfish/jersey/servlet/WebComponent.(Lorg/glassfish/jersey/servlet/WebConfig;Lorg/glassfish/jersey/server/ResourceConfig;)V @177: invokespecial   Reason:     Type 'org/glassfish/jersey/server/ResourceConfig' (current frame, stack[3]) is not assignable to 'javax/ws/rs/core/Application' ```  And I cannot find a way to fix this error. Any suggestion?

I see a tag for [v2.1.0](https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/releases/tag/v2.1.0) However it looks like there was not any release notes for this. It also appears the artifacts were shipped to [maven central](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/io.dropwizard/dropwizard-core/2.1.0)    Was this an accidental release? or is this version ready to be picked up with the beta features?

I have successfully deployed my application on my local server. The problem is that i can access the server using localhost/ip on the server but unable to access it using the server IP locally or from other machine on the same network. And "Yes", my network is configured correctly. Can someone help please. Here is my server configurations:  server:   application_connectors:   - type: http     port: 8989   request_log:       appenders: []   admin_connectors:   - type: http     port: 8991

column3: Integration tests overwrite global log config
column4: I have a bunch of integration tests and unit tests, all setup according to the way the documentation specifies. However, when executing `mvn clean package` it runs the tests, and as soon as it has hit an integration test, it seems to completely overwrite the config that is supposed to be in logback.xml.  The sample output is this  ``` [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.ZipServiceImplTest [INFO] Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.909 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.ZipServiceImplTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.BagExtractorImplTest [INFO] Tests run: 18, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.197 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.BagExtractorImplTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.BagItManagerImplTest [INFO] Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.017 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.BagItManagerImplTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.FilesystemSpaceVerifierImplTest [INFO] Tests run: 7, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.013 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.FilesystemSpaceVerifierImplTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.DepositHandlerImplTest [INFO] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.291 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.core.service.DepositHandlerImplTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.auth.SwordAuthenticatorTest [INFO] Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.34 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.auth.SwordAuthenticatorTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.DiskSpaceHealthCheckTest [INFO] Tests run: 4, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.021 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.DiskSpaceHealthCheckTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.FileSystemPermissionHealthCheckTest [INFO] Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.008 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.FileSystemPermissionHealthCheckTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.QueueHealthCheckTest [INFO] Tests run: 5, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.064 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.QueueHealthCheckTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.UploadDepositOnSameFileSystemHealthCheckTest [INFO] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.004 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.health.UploadDepositOnSameFileSystemHealthCheckTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.resource.ServiceDocumentResourceImplTest [INFO] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 2.369 s - in nl.knaw.dans.sword2.resource.ServiceDocumentResourceImplTest [INFO] Running nl.knaw.dans.sword2.resource.BaseResourceTest WARN  [2022-06-29 15:10:00,263] nl.knaw.dans.sword2.resource.BaseResource: Invalid content-length header: letter3 WARN  [2022-06-29 15:10:00,266] nl.knaw.dans.sword2.resource.BaseResource: Invalid content-length header: 123suffix WARN  [2022-06-29 15:10:00,266] nl.knaw.dans.sword2.resource.BaseResource: Invalid content-length header: prefix123 ```  The log statements at the end should not be there. The `ServiceDocumentResourceImplTest` creates a DropwizardAppExtension like so:  ```     private DropwizardAppExtension EXT = new DropwizardAppExtension<>(         DdSword2Application.class,         ResourceHelpers.resourceFilePath("test-etc/config-servicedocument.yml")     ); ```  If one of the unit tests runs after this test runs, the configured logging that was active prior is no longer active.   This means that there is some global logging config that runs inside the testing process and is configured multiple times, so the test order messes things up. Is there a way to prevent the DropwizardAppExtension from overwriting the global log config?

column3: File Appender writes on Mac but not windows
column4: I have a (complex) configuration where I'm using my FIleAppenderFactory to extend RollingFileAppender so that I can parse out which messages to append. (Arguably I could do this with file filters and additive appenders, but we've got a complex enough situation where we were 90% of the way there, that it felt easier to do this, and we also do some mods of the filenames and other things, so we had a file appender factory already).  Things start up without complaint, the log files are created, I see logs coming in and I pass them to the super.doAppend in the RollingFileAppender, and it works on Mac (both from IntelliJ command line and when run via Jar). But if I take that same jar and run it on windows, the system works normally, all the expected logs are created .... but nothing ever gets written). I can see (via sysouts) the same settings getting created in my rolling file appender, and the same "I got this log, should I write it" messages my class puts out, and the calls to super.doAppend() ... but nothing?  Before I had the same issue on Mac and Windows, but that may have been because I was using a delegation model and with some methods.  Note -- I do not call the super.buildAppender() in my factory (but I just cut and pasted the relevant code) because when I called the supper.buildAppender, the logs did not write on Windows or Mac.   Are there known issues that might be causing this? If not I will submit more information for a full bug report.

Hi,  I am currently doing some research on Estimating Time Taken for Software Refactoring. Dropwizard is one of my case studies being a highly popular project.  I have identified some packages with refactoring potential and their estimated time to refactor. Would appreciate your kind feedback on the appropriateness of the estimated time to refactor.  1. io.dropwizard.migrations - 60 hours 2. io.dropwizard.logging - 58 hours 3. io.dropwizard.validation - 53 hours 4. io.dropwizard.util - 37 hours 5. io.dropwizard.hibernate - 32 hours  I will be grateful for any help you can provide.  Thank you.  Regards, Alvin

column3: Multipart upload stopped working when updating from 2.1.0 to 2.1.1
column4: Hi DW-Team! 🙂   One of our tests stopped working after updating to Dropwizard 2.1.1. At first glance I thought it was caused by updating Jersey to 2.36 and created an issue in their repo: https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/jersey/issues/5094  Then I found your update notes: https://www.dropwizard.io/en/latest/manual/upgrade-notes/upgrade-notes-2_1_x.html#modification-of-the-client-in-dropwizardappextension  Can you decide if there are more changes needed for migration? It does not seem to be 100% backwards compatible.  Cheers,  Christopher  **Edit:**  I could get my test running when I go back to the old client as documented in your upgrade notes. Do you think we should close this issue again?

column3: Question: Jackson update to 2.13 for Dropwizard 2.x?
column4: Hi @joschi !  Do you plan to upgrade the 2.x branch to Jackson 2.13? Are there any known issues that prohibit the upgrade?  Thanks for the great work and for clarification! 😃   Christopher

Hello, my (non-dropwizard) client sends the header "Expect: 100-continue", but dropwizard does not seem to reply properly with a 100-continue header or even let me do it manually. How can I instruct dropwizard to do this?

Hello, I am upgrading a project to Java 17 and was resolving the dependency issues when I found this one.  I am also upgrading to DropWizard 2.1.0 to get the compatible jersey versions with some of our other integrations, then I run into this issue:  java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/fasterxml/jackson/databind/PropertyNamingStrategies$SnakeCaseStrategy  Seeing the AnnotationSensitivePropertyNamingStrategy.class, it is using PropertyNamingStrategies from Jackson, however the DW2.1 is using Jackson 2.11 and this class is from Since 2.13.  I can just pick 2.13 in the classpath to override, however it is something to see.
Hello,  I noticed the release of Dropwizard 2.1.0 on the Maven repository. Is this the full release/is this safe to use? Will release notes be coming soon?  Thank you.

column3: `dropwizard-migrations` uses wrong class for resolving files on the file system
column4: For resolving files on the file system in the `dropwizard-migrations` module, the root paths are provided as well as a code source path ([see here](https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/blob/release/2.1.x/dropwizard-migrations/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/migrations/CloseableLiquibaseWithFileSystemMigrationsFile.java#L43-L45)). The code source is thereby the `dropwizard-migrations` jar instead of the currently executing jar (when not using a shaded jar).  As we have the option to use the `CloseableLiquibaseWithClassPathMigrationsFile` for resolving classes in the current jar, it should be enough to provide the root paths from the file system for the `CloseableLiquibaseWithFileSystemMigrationsFile`. Therefore the code source path can be removed.

column3: Add ability to configure the ObjectMapper
column4: Follow up for #5472.  This is just a basic implementation for my idea mentioned in the referenced PR.  Further considerations:  1. Propagate the created `ObjectMapper` to e.g. the `dropwizard-logging` module  2. Change the return type of `Jackson#configure(ObjectMapper)` to `void`  3. Add a section in the upgrade notes on how to disable Blackbird

column3: dropwizard-health: improve logging behavior when check's state is initially set to false
column4: Dropwizard version: 2.1.0-beta.7  A health check can be configured to have an `initialState` of `false` so that an app won't prematurely advertise itself as being healthy before it has a chance to perform a check. When that is configured, an `ERROR` level statement is logged during startup.  Instead, since this is a supported configuration, this case should not be considered an error.  > ERROR [2022-03-09 20:47:23,946] io.dropwizard.health.HealthCheckManager [thread=main]: A critical dependency is now unhealthy: name=example-app-db, type=READY
Dropwizard 3.0 will drop support for Java 8 and this class will no longer be necessary.  Mark it as deprecated now, to give users some notice.

dropwizard 2.0.28 relies on log4j version 1.7.32 as in the screenshot. This version is vulnerable as per the CVE-2022-23307. Please suggest the version of dropwizard containing the fix.  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4299180/152288209-fb598543-41c5-414b-aaa1-ea327342df99.png)

Deprecate `ByteStreams` and `Maps` as an indicator that they are to be removed in Dropwizard 3.x.  Raised in relation to https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4914 and https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4916

column3: add ability to configure custom alive endpoints
column4: Currently after the addition of the health-module into Dropwizard core it allows users to pass a list of [custom endpoints](https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/blob/release/2.1.x/dropwizard-health/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/health/DefaultHealthFactory.java#L61) that it will also listen on. However, these endpoints all default to the readiness of the application unless you pass the `?type=alive` query param. It would be nice if you could configure another list of liveness endpoints that defaulted to the above behavior without the query param present.   This would bring this project in line with [spring boots probe settings](https://spring.io/blog/2020/03/25/liveness-and-readiness-probes-with-spring-boot) and better in line with [k8s probes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/)  I'm happy to contribute the changes for this if the maintainers agree.
commons-lang3 was only used for `ExceptionUtils` in order to navigate exception chains.  Add a helper method to dropwizard-util `Throwables` to perform the same task.

column3: Remove code source path in favor of `CloseableLiquibaseWithClassPathMigrationsFile`
column4: Closes #5428

column3: Change log messages for unhealthy initialized health checks
column4: Closes #4944   This PR maintains a flag in a `SchaduledHealthCheck`, if the check already had recovered. This provides the ability to display a better log message, if the check was initialized as unhealthy.

column3: Append value of counter instead of toString output
column4: Closes #4943   This outputs the value of the `Counter` except when the `Counter` is overridden. If a user provides a custom implementation of a `toString` method, probably that one should be used.

column3: Clarify support for Dropwizard 1.3.x in security policy
column4: Closes #4583

Closes #3226   `LogbackAccessRequestLog` is registered as a bean, but [doesn't implement `LifeCycle`](https://github.com/qos-ch/logback/pull/269). As this PR is open for over 6 years, I'd suggest to fix this on our side.  If we manually implement `LifeCycle`, which the `RequestLogImpl` actually does with its methods, the component is registered as a managed object rather then a POJO and therefore is started and stopped by the Jetty server.
Check in a new test db file for h2 v2 and update the dependency.  Closes https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4631 Closes https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/pull/4865

Bumps [h2](https://github.com/h2database/h2database) from 1.4.200 to 2.1.210.  Release notes Sourced from h2's releases.  Version 2.1.210 Two security vulnerabilities in H2 Console (CVE-2022-23221 and possible DNS rebinding attack) are fixed. Persistent databases created by H2 2.0.x don't need to be upgraded. Persistent databases created by H2 1.4.200 and older versions require export into SQL script with that old version and creation of a new database with the new version and execution of this script in it.   ... Bumps [h2](https://github.com/h2database/h2database) from 1.4.200 to 2.0.206.  Release notes Sourced from h2's releases.  Version 2.0.206 Critical security issue with H2 console is fixed. Also important changes included:  Version 2.0.204 Multilple regression fixes discovered after 2.0.202 release, There are no persistence changes between 2.0.202 and 2.0.204, so jar file swap is enough, if database had been upgraded to 2.0.202 already, otherwise please read the message below: Between version 1.4.200 and version 2.0.202 there have been considerable changes, such that a simple update is not possible. The official way to upgrade is to do a BACKUP of your existing database USING YOUR CURRENT VERSION OF H2. Then create a fresh database USING THE NEW VERSION OF H2, then perform a SCRIPT to load your data. Version 2.0.202 Besides many dozens of fixed bugs, performance improvements, more adherence to a standard SQL syntax and type system, there are Some new features:  Complete re-work of INFORMATION_SCHEMA to be more in-line with the standard Support for new types: ARRAY, ROW, JAVA_OBJECT Numerous bit, string, array and system functions implemented Standard-based access to generated keys JDBC 4.2 compliance Support for JDK 7 is dropped PageStore is discontinued  MVStore changes:  Descending MVMap and TransactionMap cursor Disk space reclamation algorithm improvements  Between version 1.4.200 and version 2.0.202 there have been considerable changes, such that a simple update is not possible. The official way to upgrade is to do a BACKUP of your existing database USING YOUR CURRENT VERSION OF H2. Then create a fresh database USING THE NEW VERSION OF H2, then perform a SCRIPT to load your data. CodeQL Action Changelog [UNRELEASED] No user facing changes. 2.1.17 - 28 Jul 2022  Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.10.1.  #1143  2.1.16 - 13 Jul 2022  You can now quickly debug a job that uses the CodeQL Action by re-running the job from the GitHub UI and selecting the "Enable debug logging" option. #1132 You can now see diagnostic messages produced by the analysis in the logs of the analyze Action by enabling debug mode. To enable debug mode, pass debug: true to the init Action, or enable step debug logging. This feature is available for CodeQL CLI version 2.10.0 and later. #1133  2.1.15 - 28 Jun 2022  CodeQL query packs listed in the packs configuration field will be skipped if their target language is not being analyzed in the current Actions job. This behavior can be disabled by setting the wait-for-processing action input to "false". #1007 Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.9.0. Bumps [actions/stale](https://github.com/actions/stale) from 5.0.0 to 5.1.0.  Release notes Sourced from actions/stale's releases.  v5.1.0 [5.1.0] Don't process stale issues right after they're marked stale Add close-issue-reason option #764#772 Various dependabot/dependency updates    Changelog Sourced from actions/stale's changelog.  Changelog [5.1.0] Don't process stale issues right after they're marked stale [Add close-issue-reason option]#764#772 Various dependabot/dependency updates 4.1.0 (2021-07-14) Features  Ability to exempt draft PRs  4.0.0 (2021-07-14) Features  options: simplify config by removing skip stale message options (#457) (6ec637d), closes #405 #455 output: print output parameters (#458) (3e6d35b)  Bug Fixes  dry-run: forbid mutations in dry-run (#500) (f1017f3), closes #499 logs: coloured logs (#465) (5fbbfba) operations: fail fast the current batch to respect the operations limit (#474) (5f6f311), closes #466 label comparison: make label comparison case insensitive #517, closes #516 filtering comments by actor could have strange behavior: "stale" comments are now detected based on if the message is the stale message not who made the comment(#519), fixes #441, #509, #518  Breaking Changes  The options skip-stale-issue-message and skip-stale-pr-message were removed. Instead, setting the options stale-issue-message and stale-pr-message will be enough to let the stale workflow add a comment. If the options are unset, a comment will not be added which was the equivalent of setting skip-stale-issue-message to true. The operations-per-run option will be more effective. After migrating, you could face a failed-fast process workflow if you let the default value (30) or set it to a small number. In that case, you will see a warning at the end of the logs (if enabled) indicating that the workflow was stopped sooner to avoid consuming too much API calls. In most cases, you can just increase this limit to make sure to process everything in a single run. Bumps [actions/cache](https://github.com/actions/cache) from 2.1.7 to 3.  Release notes Sourced from actions/cache's releases.  v3.0.0   This change adds a minimum runner version(node12 -> node16), which can break users using an out-of-date/fork of the runner. This would be most commonly affecting users on GHES 3.3 or before, as those runners do not support node16 actions and they can use actions from github.com via github connect or manually copying the repo to their GHES instance.   Few dependencies and cache action usage examples have also been updated. AssetServlet has `getResourceURL()` and `getResourceUrl(String)`, which is deemed potentially confusing by Sonar.  `getResourceURL()` goes back all the way to 2012 in commit 482b9f552ecb1d0a44a11fba7acdfb35843f2723 whereas `getResourceUrl(String)` is a relative newcomer, added in 2015 in cc20a03a3a297646589ea50c1cd9d8ef5a8c1cc4.  Provide `getResourceURL(String)` as a preferred replacement for `getResourceUrl(String)`, but delegate to the existing method for now, to give anyone subclassing `AssetServlet` time to migrate their usage.

column3: Make better use of AssertJ `AtomicAssert` and `FutureAssert`
column4: AssertJ supports asserting on Atomic* types directly - no need to call `.get()`.  Also, make use of `FutureAssert` when asserting on `Future`s.
AssertJ supports asserting on `AtomicInteger` and friends so there's no need to call `.get()` explicitly.

column3: Reduce use of reflection in tests
column4: AssertJ has dark magical powers and the `extracting` method by default can bypass access restrictions.  Remove the reflection trickery we were using and rely on AssertJ to save us instead.

AssertJ 3.22.0 adds `singleElement()` for `ObjectArrayAssert`. Use it in `GzipHandlerTest`.  Use parameterized tests in `ExecutorServiceBuilderTest`  AssertJ supports asserting on `AtomicInteger` and friends so there's no need to call .get() explicitly.

As the docs state, Liquibase [changed the file handling](https://docs.liquibase.com/concepts/changelogs/how-liquibase-finds-files.html) in 4.x.x. Therefore migration files from the file system aren't found any more.  ``` liquibase.exception.ChangeLogParseException: The file db/changelog/migrations.xml was not found in Specifying files by absolute path was removed in Liquibase 4.0. Please use a relative path or add '/' to the classpath parameter. 	at liquibase.parser.core.xml.XMLChangeLogSAXParser.parseToNode(XMLChangeLogSAXParser.java:99) 	at liquibase.parser.core.xml.AbstractChangeLogParser.parse(AbstractChangeLogParser.java:15) 	at liquibase.Liquibase.getDatabaseChangeLog(Liquibase.java:369) 	at liquibase.Liquibase.lambda$update$1(Liquibase.java:224) 	at liquibase.Scope.lambda$child$0(Scope.java:180) 	at liquibase.Scope.child(Scope.java:189) 	at liquibase.Scope.child(Scope.java:179) 	at liquibase.Scope.child(Scope.java:158) 	at liquibase.Liquibase.runInScope(Liquibase.java:2405) 	at liquibase.Liquibase.update(Liquibase.java:211) 	at liquibase.Liquibase.update(Liquibase.java:197) 	at liquibase.Liquibase.update(Liquibase.java:193) 	at liquibase.Liquibase.update(Liquibase.java:185) 	at io.dropwizard.migrations.DbMigrateCommand.run(DbMigrateCommand.java:65) 	at io.dropwizard.migrations.DbCommand.run(DbCommand.java:70) 	at io.dropwizard.migrations.AbstractLiquibaseCommand.run(AbstractLiquibaseCommand.java:68) 	at io.dropwizard.cli.ConfiguredCommand.run(ConfiguredCommand.java:98) 	at io.dropwizard.cli.Cli.run(Cli.java:78) 	at io.dropwizard.Application.run(Application.java:94) ```  This should be caused from [not setting any root path to the `FileSystemResourceAccessor`](https://github.com/dropwizard/dropwizard/blob/release/2.1.x/dropwizard-migrations/src/main/java/io/dropwizard/migrations/CloseableLiquibaseWithFileSystemMigrationsFile.java#L20).
As reported by `mvn dependency:analyze`

As denoted in #5136, JSR305 causes problems on Java 9+ due to reusing the `javax.annotation` package.  But the annotations from JSR305 can be replaced with annotations from other packages. NullAway states in the [configuration docs](https://github.com/uber/NullAway/wiki/Configuration#custom-nullability-annotations), that any annotations with the names `@Nullable`, `@Nonnull`, `@NonNull` and `@NotNull` are considered and not only those from JSR305. Therefore the annotations from `org.jetbrains.annotations` should be fine. (I've used Jetbrains' annotations here, since the package is much smaller than `checker-qual` or similar packages.)  The annotations of the package `javax.annotation.concurrent` can be replaced by annotations from errorprone. The [errorprone docs](https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/Immutable) additionally state, that the JSR305 `@Immutable` annotation is not evaluated, but the errorprone one is. So we should have an additional advantage there.  The one `@NotThreadSafe` annotation is replaced with jUnit's `@Execution(SAME_THREAD)`, as it was done in #5149.

Appease some more Sonar grumbles  - Add an assertion to `DropwizardTestSupportTest#isCustomFactoryCalled()` - Rename `AbstractHttp2Test` to `Http2TestCommon` - Remove the static initialiser from `AbstractMigrationTest` - Replace `AbstractMigrationTest` with some static helper methods.  The static initialiser which unregistered `AddColumnGeneratorSQLite.class` no longer seems to be necessary (added in fe842d2fcf13c3d8eb67ad50219f929b0989539b in 2018 as part of the Liquibase 3.6.0 upgrade)

All code and documentation that I have looked through (such as https://www.dropwizard.io/en/latest/manual/configuration.html#tls) don't mention TLS1.3.  If no supportedProtocols key is provided, will dropwizard negotiate TLS1.3 if it is available?

column3: UnitOfWork - java.lang.IllegalStateException: Existing session transaction state (false) does not match requested (true)
column4: After upgrading the dropwizard to 2.0.25, I am started getting this exception in the methods having @unitOfwork annotations ,  Can you help me out to rectify these errors ? why I am getting these errors now ?  `Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Existing session transaction state (false) does not match requested (true) at io.dropwizard.hibernate.UnitOfWorkAspect.validateSession(UnitOfWorkAspect.java:178) at io.dropwizard.hibernate.UnitOfWorkAspect.beforeStart(UnitOfWorkAspect.java:85)`
After setting the baseline for Dropwizard to Java 11, we can simplify the Error Prone configuration which had to account running on Java 8, 11, and 17 before.
After setting the baseline for Dropwizard to Java 11, we can simplify the Error Prone configuration which had to account running on Java 8, 11, and 17 before.

Address a few linter concerns  - Add missing `@Deprecated` tag to FreemarkerViewRenderer constructor - Simplify dropwizard-jersey CustomDerialization (test helper) - Fix javadoc reference in dropwizard-core Bundle - Adjust test class name in LazyLoadingTest - Remove unused imports from DataSourceFactoryTest - Remove unnecessary cast from DefaultServerFactory - Fix markdown in SECURITY.md - Remove unnecessary character escape - Remove stray `@JsonProperty` in MetricsFactory

column3: Add deprecation annotation for ByteStreams#toByteArray method
column4: Add deprecation annotation to remove `ByteStreams#toByteArray` in DW 3. Related to #4916

add configuration for maxIdle in dataSourceFactory.java  ###### Problem: We have used dropwiard in our microservices application and we have encountred a problem related to the number of inactif connections that still opened and the configuation of maxIdle resolve the problem   ###### Solution: add the possibility to configure the maxIdle Variable in DataSourceFactory   ###### Result:  the configuration of  maxIdle resolve our problem
`StringLookup` is a functional interface and so `EnvironmentVariableLookup` can be implemented as a direct method reference to `System#getenv()`.

column3: Deprecate the `Size` validators in favour of `DataSize` validators
column4: `Size` is deprecated in favour of `DataSize` so it makes sense to also deprecate the corresponding validators.
`org.glassfish.hk2.external:jakarta.inject` is a repackaged OSGi version of `javax.inject` and can be replaced by `jakarta.inject:jakarta.inject-api`.  Closes #5527
`maven-enforcer-plugin` had an issue in v3.0.0 with the `DependencyConvergence` rule. v3.1.0 seems to have that fixed.  Refs #4196

column3: Remove inconsistency in CsvReporterFactory's directory handling
column4: `CsvReporterFactory#build(MetricRegistry)` does all its validation directory on the `file` field but uses the result of `getFile()` when actually constructing the `CsvReporter`.  If someone were to subclass and override `getFile()` this would lead to confusing behaviour.  Use `getFile()` instead of directly accessing the field.  In addition, the `file` variable in `build(MetricRegistry)` shadowed the `file` field. Rename it to `directory` to avoid this.

`AbstractLifeCycleListener` is deprecated since `LifeCycle.Listener` gained default methods.  Deprecate `HttpsConnectionFactory#logSslInfoOnStart(SslContextFactory) since its return type is the deprecated `AbstractLifeCycle.AbstractLifeCycleListener` but should probably have been `LifeCycle.Listener` all along.  Deprecate the existing method and replace it with a new method, `logSslParameters(SslContextFactory)` which just delegates to the old method until we remove it.

_Question_ This is a bit speculative - I don't _think_ these helpers seem to offer much value, but maybe you know differently?  Jackson can read directly from `URL`s and `InputStream`s so these helpers don't especially useful.  In addition, Java 9+ has `InputStream#readAllBytes()` which can be combined with `String(byte[])` to parse resources to strings.

  [#​10112](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10112): extlinks: Disable hardcoded links detector by default -   [#​9993](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9993), [#​10177](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10177): std domain: Disallow to refer an inline target via     :rst:role:`ref` role  ## Deprecated  -   `sphinx.ext.napoleon.docstring.GoogleDocstring._qualify_name()`  ## Features added  -   [#​10260](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10260): Enable `FORCE_COLOR` and `NO_COLOR` for terminal colouring -   [#​10234](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10234): autosummary: Add "autosummary" CSS class to summary tables -   [#​10125](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10125): extlinks: Improve suggestion message for a reference having title -   [#​10112](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10112): extlinks: Add :confval:`extlinks_detect_hardcoded_links` to enable     hardcoded links detector feature -   [#​9494](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9494), [#​9456](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9456): html search: Add a config variable     :confval:`html_show_search_summary` to enable/disable the search summaries -   [#​9337](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9337): HTML theme, add option `enable_search_shortcuts` that enables :kbd:'/' as     a Quick search shortcut and :kbd:`Esc` shortcut that     removes search highlighting. -   [#​10107](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10107): i18n: Allow to suppress translation warnings by adding `#noqa`     comment to the tail of each translation message -   [#​10252](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10252): C++, support attributes on classes, unions, and enums. -   [#​10253](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10253): :rst:dir:`pep` role now generates URLs based on peps.python.org  ## Bugs fixed  -   [#​9876](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9876): autodoc: Failed to document an imported class that is built from native     binary module -   [#​10133](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10133): autodoc: Crashed when mocked module is used for type annotation -   [#​10146](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10146): autodoc: :confval:`autodoc_default_options` does not support     `no-value` option -   [#​9971](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9971): autodoc: TypeError is raised when the target object is annotated by     unhashable object -   [#​10205](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10205): extlinks: Failed to compile regexp on checking hardcoded links -   [#​10277](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10277): html search: Could not search short words (ex. "use") -   [#​9529](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9529): LaTeX: named auto numbered footnote (ex. `[#named]`) that is referred     multiple times was rendered to a question mark -   [#​9924](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9924): LaTeX: multi-line :rst:dir:`cpp:function` directive has big vertical     spacing in Latexpdf -   [#​10158](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10158): LaTeX: excessive whitespace since v4.4.0 for undocumented     variables/structure members -   [#​10175](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10175): LaTeX: named footnote reference is linked to an incorrect footnote if     the name is also used in the different document -   [#​10269](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10269): manpage: Failed to resolve the title of :ref: cross references -   [#​10179](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10179): i18n: suppress "rST localization" warning -   [#​10118](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10118): imgconverter: Unnecessary availablity check is called for remote URIs -   [#​10181](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10181): napoleon: attributes are displayed like class attributes for google     style docstrings when :confval:`napoleon_use_ivar` is enabled -   [#​10122](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10122): sphinx-build: make.bat does not check the installation of sphinx-build     command before showing help    ---  ### Configuration  📅 **Schedule**: "before 2am" (UTC).  🚦 **Automerge**: Disabled by config. The default behaviour is unchanged. Autogen also now supports     this behavior with the `--respect-module-all` switch. -   [#​9555](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9555): autosummary: Improve error messages on failure to load target object -   [#​9800](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9800): extlinks: Emit warning if a hardcoded link is replaceable     by an extlink, suggesting a replacement. -   [#​9961](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9961): html: Support nested  HTML elements in other HTML builders -   [#​10013](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10013): html: Allow to change the loading method of JS via `loading_method`     parameter for :meth:`Sphinx.add_js_file()` -   [#​9551](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9551): html search: "Hide Search Matches" link removes "highlight" parameter     from URL -   [#​9815](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9815): html theme: Wrap sidebar components in div to allow customizing their     layout via CSS -   [#​9827](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9827): i18n: Sort items in glossary by translated terms -   [#​9899](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9899): py domain: Allows to specify cross-reference specifier (`.` and     `~`) as `:type:` option -   [#​9894](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9894): linkcheck: add option `linkcheck_exclude_documents` to disable link     checking in matched documents. -   [#​9793](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9793): sphinx-build: Allow to use the parallel build feature in macOS on macOS     and Python3.8+ -   [#​10055](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10055): sphinx-build: Create directories when `-w` option given -   [#​9993](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9993): std domain: Allow to refer an inline target (ex. \`\`\_`target name```)     via :rst:role:`ref\` role -   [#​9981](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9981): std domain: Strip value part of the option directive from general index -   [#​9391](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9391): texinfo: improve variable in `samp` role -   [#​9578](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9578): texinfo: Add :confval:`texinfo_cross_references` to disable cross     references for readability with standalone readers -   [#​9822](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9822) (and [#​9062](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9062)), add new Intersphinx role :rst:role:`external` for explict     lookup in the external projects, without resolving to the local project.  ## Bugs fixed  -   [#​9866](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9866): autodoc: doccomment for the imported class was ignored -   [#​9883](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9883): autodoc: doccomment for the alias to mocked object was ignored -   [#​9908](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9908): autodoc: debug message is shown on building document using NewTypes     with Python 3.10 -   [#​9968](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9968): autodoc: instance variables are not shown if **init** method has     position-only-arguments -   [#​9194](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9194): autodoc: types under the "typing" module are not hyperlinked -   [#​10009](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10009): autodoc: Crashes if target object raises an error on getting docstring -   [#​10058](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10058): autosummary: Imported members are not shown when     `autodoc_class_signature = 'separated'` -   [#​9947](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9947): i18n: topic directive having a bullet list can't be translatable -   [#​9878](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9878): mathjax: MathJax configuration is placed after loading MathJax itself -   [#​9932](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9932): napoleon: empty "returns" section is generated even if no description -   [#​9857](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9857): Generated RFC links use outdated base url -   [#​9909](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9909): HTML, prevent line-wrapping in literal text. -   [#​10061](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10061): html theme: Configuration values added by themes are not be able to     override from conf.py -   [#​10073](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10073): imgconverter: Unnecessary availablity check is called for "data" URIs -   [#​9925](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9925): LaTeX: prohibit also with `'xelatex'` line splitting at dashes of     inline and parsed literals -   [#​9944](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9944): LaTeX: extra vertical whitespace for some nested declarations -   [#​9940](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9940): LaTeX: Multi-function declaration in Python domain has cramped     vertical spacing in latexpdf output -   [#​10015](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10015): py domain: types under the "typing" module are not hyperlinked defined     at info-field-list -   [#​9390](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9390): texinfo: Do not emit labels inside footnotes -   [#​9413](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9413): xml: Invalid XML was generated when cross referencing python objects -   [#​9979](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9979): Error level messages were displayed as warning messages -   [#​10057](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/10057): Failed to scan documents if the project is placed onto the root     directory -   [#​9636](https://togithub.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/9636): code-block: `:dedent:` without argument did strip newlines    ---  ### Configuration  📅 **Schedule**: "before 2am" (UTC).  🚦 **Automerge**: Disabled by config.
